Key Match Events: LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller returned to the Hornets lineup after missing three games with their respective injuries.
Ball scored 24 points on 7-of-20 shooting from the field, including 3-of-11 from outside the arc, and added four assists and three rebounds in 33 minutes.
Miller scored 24 points on 8-of-14 shooting from the field, going 6-of-10 from long range, and added two rebounds, two assists, and one block in 32 minutes.

Nick Smith Jr. scored a season-high 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting from the field and 4-of-6 shooting from outside the arc, along with five rebounds, two assists, and one block in 20 minutes off the bench.
Miles Bridges and Mark Williams both nearly recorded double-doubles with Bridges scoring 11 points and grabbing eight rebounds, and Williams scoring 11 points and grabbing nine rebounds.
Post-Match Reflections: Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee commented on the team's slow start and the need for better offensive possessions to reduce pressure on their defense.
Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee praised Nick Smith Jr. for taking full advantage of his opportunity to play and highlighted his hard work with the Greensboro staff.
